event: Arawak-speaking peoples settle in Grenada from South America.
Island inhabited by the Caribs (Kalinago), who displace earlier Arawak settlers.
Christopher Columbus sights Grenada during his third voyage and names it 'Concepción'.
English attempt to settle Grenada but are repelled by the Caribs.
French settlers from Martinique colonize Grenada and establish settlements.
Grenada ceded to Britain by France under the Treaty of Paris.
France recaptures Grenada during the American Revolutionary War.
Grenada restored to Britain by the Treaty of Versailles.
Slavery abolished in the British Empire, including Grenada.
Grenada joins the West Indies Federation.
Becomes an associated state with full internal self-government.
Grenada gains full independence from the United Kingdom on February 7.
Marxist-Leninist New Jewel Movement, led by Maurice Bishop, overthrows the government in a coup.
Internal power struggle leads to Bishop’s execution; U.S. leads military invasion and restores order.
Democratic elections held; constitutional government restored.
Hurricane Ivan devastates Grenada, causing widespread damage.
Tillman Thomas elected Prime Minister, marking peaceful political transition.
Grenada responds to COVID-19 pandemic with lockdowns and economic stimulus measures.
